Tucson could hear the Predacon in the room and sense his signature.  At thi=
s time he felt there was no time to actually deal with enemy forces and hav=
ing one directly in the same room was not good, but at the same time, this =
predacon wasn't making any moves to attack anyone, as he could rightfully s=
ense.  Yet, his pressense does make him uneasy.  

" Leo Prime, have the Ar=
k checked for loopholes in our security system, if this predacon was able t=
o breach our system there may be a chance  that others could slip easilly b=
y our security system. We can't afford to have our operations compromised, =
not now. And where the pit is Rodimus?"

Straight Shot makes it back in the=
 room, as Tucson asks the question.

" He's trying to find Wheelie."

Tucso=
n nodds.

" Of course, but does it have to take that long?  Anyway, Leo Pri=
me, given the situation at hand, which you have described as rightfully imi=
nent, we will have to do everything in our power to be sure that this plane=
t is kept undesturbed, and left as Nature intended it to evolve.  But in or=
der to do that, we need an energy supply to boost the Ark's systems, and ri=
ght now we don't have that, but, we will if we take Quickstride's proposal =
into consideration.  Energy is everything but at the same time, we do not w=
ant to steal from this planet, when we can actually develop ways to produce=
 our own by working with it rather than against it.  Perceptor brought up a=
 very valid point as well.  Hydras did have access to power, but unlike Qui=
ckstride's method of harnessing it, he just left it to go out of control, a=
nd look where that got him.  We have the upper hand, a means to work with a=
 natural resource that is less harmful to some degree, and will not risk an=
y danger to our lives and those that reside on this planet.  Now, as soon a=
s Rodimus gets here, I'd like Quickstride to explain and show all of us, th=
e project he's working on, to provide the Ark with an energy source."

He t=
urns to Quickstride once more.

" After all, energy is everything, and we h=
ave to do everything in our power to produce and concerve it."
